item.title: Carrie add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Forever is composed of nows." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences" -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Carrie add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "It's all very well to read about sorrows and imagine yourself living through them heroically, but it's not so nice when you really come to have them, is it?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "And sometimes you do everything right and something bad just happens. It's as simple, and as scary, as that." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Dostoevski
item.description: "If everything on earth were rational, nothing would happen." -- Dostoevski

item.title: Carrie add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "Now I know I've got a heart because it is breaking. - Tin Man" -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "A great hope fell You heard no noise The ruin was within." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "The silence depressed me. It wasn't the silence of silence. It was my own silence." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Carrie add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more." -- C. S. Lewis

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "[In the aftermath of death] Small talk feels too small, big talk too enormous." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "â€ŽI never wanted to have anything in my life that I couldn't stand losing. But it's too late for that." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "Nothing is ever really lost to us as long as we remember it." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Carrie add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "There is nothing to save, now all is lost, but a tiny core of stillness in the heart like the eye of a violet." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart. I am, I am, I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Carrie add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I am well in body though considerably rumpled up in spirit." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "So that's how we live our lives. No matter how deep and fatal the loss, no matter how important the thing that's stolen from us--that's snatched right out of our hands--even if we are left completely changed, with only the outer layer of skin from before, we continue to play out our lives this way, in silence. We draw ever nearer to the end of our allotted span of time, bidding it farewell as it trails off behind. Repeating, often adroitly, the endless deeds of the everyday. Leaving behind a feeling of immeasurable emptiness." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Carrie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "I know what the fear is. The fear is not for what is lost. What is lost is already in the wall. What is lost is already behind the locked doors. The fear is for what is still to be lost." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Carrie add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I can't cheer up â€” I don't want to cheer up. It's nicer to be miserable!" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man is sometimes extraordinarily, passionately, in love with suffering..." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Carrie add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "One thing you can't hide - is when you're crippled inside." -- John Lennon

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Fiona Apple
item.description: "It's calm under the waves in the blue of my oblivion." -- Fiona Apple

item.title: Carrie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Pain insists upon being attended to. God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our consciences, but shouts in our pains. It is his megaphone to rouse a deaf world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Carrie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Crying is all right in its way while it lasts. But you have to stop sooner or later, and then you still have to decide what to do." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Sorrow compressed my heart, and I felt I would die, and then . . . Well, then I woke up." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Unable are the loved to die. For love is immortality." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "And if there's love, you can do without happiness too. Even with sorrow, life is sweet. " -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Carrie add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "And if you couldn't be loved, the next best thing was to be let alone." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "How do you get so empty? Who takes it out of you?" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Carrie add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Oh, sometimes I think it is of no use to make friends. They only go out of your life after awhile and leave a hurt that is worse than the emptiness before they came." -- L.M. Montgomery
